author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
It looks like a precious gift of nature.

A ‘human face’ has formed on a rock at the ‘V-cut’ area of Thamburansolai coming under the Amaravathi forest range in the district. It is located close to Kerala border.

The pristine location provides a bird’s eye view of Indira Gandhi National Park under Anamalai Tiger Reserve, and the beautiful Manjampatti valley. The spot is not known to many as the entry to the area is presently restricted. Any access needs permission from Forest Department officials. The ‘human face’ can be seen on the edge of a rock that has nearly 1km deep gorge on one side.

“Tourism potential in the area is yet to be explored. The access to the top of the rock formation is easier from Kerala side,” said District Forest Officer A. Periasamy.

Some of the nature conservationists were of the opinion that it would be better if certain locations inside the forest remain cut off from the tourists as its virginity could be lost once unrestricted flow of people happens.
title: A rock with a human face
